review.title: Loved it!!
review.reviewText: Loved the staff, motel layout, outdoor pool, garden, breakfast, room:) Will definitely go back!!
review.negativeRemarks: Nothing!!
review.locationRemarks: Easy access to everything touristy!!

review.title: I've stayed at better days inn
review.reviewText: Room wasn't thoroughly cleaned, chose not to shower

review.title: everything worked out well
review.reviewText: I couldn't get into my room cause the lock wouldnt open.  but they gave me a new room and everything was fine.  no complaints at all.
review.locationRemarks: there are no stores or restaurants nearby

review.title: Nice place , nothing fancy but comfortable.
review.reviewText: Stayed for 8 nights, visiting from NJ to see my son. Hotel is clean, beds are very comfortable and lite breakfast  every morning included . It's located right off the highway, so convenient for driving to the city, ferry or wine country.I would stay again. Staff were friendly and professional.

review.title: Not a bad place to spend a night.
review.reviewText: This hotel is a little old, a little dated and in the middle of nowhere, but is clean well staffed by nice people and fairly comfortable. Check in was easy, even though Expedia screwed up my name again, and it was a slight challenge to find my reservation. This is always a bit scary when the sign out front says "NO VACANCY". In the end they found our reservation and we got the "non-smoking" room we had booked. My wife swears that someone had been smoking in it, but for me the air freshener they used masked it OK. The room was large, but out-dated, even with a smallish flat screen TV. The sliding glass door in back shared a common balcony/walk overlooking the pool. The lock on that door seemed very flimsy and was hard to use. We only opened once and then turned on the AC and locked it as best we could. The bad was OK, the bathroom was OK though the sink seemed kind of flimsy and well used. Over all it worked fine for us as an overnight rest place between days at the racetrack.
review.positiveRemarks: It was fairly reasonably priced considering it was a holiday weekend during the tourist season. It was not far from Sonoma Raceway/Sears Point, 12 min
review.negativeRemarks: The place needs a remodel, but that would raise rates. Fix the sliding glass door locks!
review.locationRemarks: I am sure there are lots of other things to do in wine country, but it is pretty darn close to Sonoma Raceway about a 12 min. drive on highway or fwy.

review.reviewText: This is a great hotel, and I will be back next year.

review.title: Good motel for its price in the region
review.reviewText: The motel was comfortable and clean enough. It was not the best motel I have ever stayed in but it was reasonable for the price.

review.title: Just what I was looking for
review.reviewText: The room and bathroom were clean, flat screen TV, breakfast was good.

review.title: Last resort
review.reviewText:
We got this room at the last minute while traveling thru California on a family vacation.  
We booked 2 rooms.  The rooms were not very comfortable at all.  The bathrooms we 
very outdated and our daughters room sink faucet was broken so they had to brush their
teeth with the shower faucet.  The grounds were very pretty and well kept.  We think they need
to spend as much time and money on the rooms as they do on the flowers.

review.title: Pleasant surprise
review.reviewText: Location and quietness of the room was a surprise.  Would stay again.

review.title: A nice place to stay...
review.reviewText:
Nice view of the Marin hills from the veranda!
A quiet space where I could get work done -
easy access to food, friends, and business.
review.locationRemarks: Whole Foods, Trader Joe's, cultural events are all close by.

review.title: Ehh, its ok.
review.reviewText: Staff are nice and helpful. The rest of the hotel is lacking.
review.negativeRemarks: The room smelled funny and didn't feel clean.
review.locationRemarks: Location is decent, next to freeway.

review.title: You get what you pay for.
review.reviewText: Room was clean. Lumps under the carpet. Bathroom could use some repair.   Vending machine over charged for soft drink.  Breakfast was not great (pre cooked omelete in a package).
review.negativeRemarks: Spend some money repairing and updating the rooms.

review.reviewText: We were well satisfied with the accommodations, clean, spacious, comfortable.  Although we had no time to use it the swimming pool looked like it was a superior one.  Continental breakfast was good.  We certainly will go back if we're in the area again.
review.locationRemarks: An ideal location for anyone going to the Mountain Play on Tamalpais.

review.title: Hotel DESCASTING
review.reviewText: Hotel descasting, recepcionist descasting, loby smell so bad,  couldn't stay just thing that My family and I  will put our faces on those pillow.   Room duty, smelling .  We have to move out another hotel  extended stay america better, clean , and We lost our money from the descasting hotel never again make reservation by internet never again.
review.negativeRemarks: To have better hotels to offers people
review.locationRemarks: Visit my daughter at Dominican University , San Rafael, California

review.title: the stay was find. but could be closer to town
review.reviewText: it was find the staff was very pleasant and helpful
review.positiveRemarks: it was clean and has dvd hook up if you bring your own
review.negativeRemarks: have off ramp closer to hotel
review.locationRemarks: most of the things to do are not very closes but we were their for a weding

review.title: Nice, last-minute accommodations.
review.reviewText: I stay with Days Inn often accommodating my cycling friends coming in from out of town. I had canceled the reservation giving up my room, and then plans changed and I needed the room again. The staff were great at notifying me that there was a cancellation and I got a room after all. Price is always very reasonable especially for the accommodations and proximity to West Marin and trails and roads.

review.title: Nice hotel in a lovely town just down the road.
review.reviewText:
We were at the Sonoma race track for the weekend, and needed a room close by the track.  This hotel is not far from the race track, and although not walking distance to town, it is only a few minutes away.  We found a great restaurant, sat outside and had a fantastic meal.
 We only stayed one night, and it more than met our expectations in this price range.  If this is in your price range, then we can recommend this hotel.
review.locationRemarks: Only stayed one night, and didn't have time to explore.  Found the nearby town to be beautiful, and was very nice on a sunny evening.

review.title: Quick check inn.
review.reviewText: I was able to check in quite rapidly. Teller was very helpful with area description. No hassle. Enjoy the stay.

review.title: old place
review.reviewText: was a bad experience no more to write!!!!!! so do your self a favor stay away!!
review.negativeRemarks: place needs a full remodel and updating

review.title: Dump
review.reviewText: Run done,wore out,noisy,smelly hotel I will never stay there again .i was quoted &365 but ended up being $399 .Breakfast was a joke

review.title: Slightly below average
review.reviewText: Staff nice but toilet hard to flush no extra towels and expensive for what you get

review.title: great find, great location
review.reviewText: After much research and reading reviews we are very happy to have chosen this hotel.  The beds are very new and quite comfortable.  The room had a nice décor and we enjoyed how the slider opened to the peaceful courtyard.  The grounds are very well maintained. Breakfast had many options and was always monitored and refilled as needed. Every staff person we interacted with was pleasant and friendly.  We did ask for a room towards the back and weren't bothered by any freeway noise. It was very easy to find off the freeway and a less than 10 minute drive to countless restaurants. According to the check out hostess they have plans to upgrade the lobby, which was in good shape already, and the room bathrooms, which I agreed are due for an upgrade, but still quite useable and decent. Would definitely stay here again.
review.positiveRemarks: Beautiful grounds, comprehensive breakfast, friendly staff, great beds.
review.negativeRemarks: The only suggestion would be to upgrade the bathrooms and perhaps put a list of what the pool policies and breakfast hours are in each room .
review.locationRemarks: Right off the freeway, many nearby restaurants, close to Muir woods, Stinston Beach, Petaluma

review.title: A good bed with a decent shower
review.reviewText: The hotel is a little run down, not exactly spic and span but the bed was comfortable and the shower was good. For the short amount of time I had it was fair value for the money. The pool area looked nice, however was surprised to see the balcony was a walkway.
review.negativeRemarks: Spend a few bucks to clean it up; could be a real nice place
review.locationRemarks: Close to the client's office and inexpensive; good value for me.

review.title: smoked out room
review.reviewText: booked a non smoking room 2 months in advance then get there to "we have only smoking rooms available." smelled and loomed like a 70s murder movies with old smoke and old carpet smells.

review.title: OK value for the price, but double verify all.
review.reviewText:
We booked our stay thru an on-line service and were told there would be no extra charge for our little Chihuahua. Upon arrival we were told that information was incorrect and that we would be assessed a $10.00 per night charge for our pet. The room was just OK, but then we weren't looking for a Taj Majal.
I wish I could remember the name of the man at the afternoon desk because he was outstanding. He did everything he could to make us comfortable and went out of his way to help us. Example: He was carrying some boxes when I asked him if he could give us directions. He put everything down and printed us a MapQuest sheet. It took several minutes from his obviously already busy morning. We left feeling satisfied and would stay again if the occasion arises.
review.positiveRemarks: The staff was very helpful and accommodating, from the maids on up.
review.negativeRemarks: It's obviously an older hotel in the chain; maybe new mattresses, clean the carpet, etc.
review.locationRemarks: We were in the San Francisco Bay area where there are many, many things to see and do given the time needed. Sequoia is near by, wine tasting, etc.

review.title: To far from center of town.
review.reviewText: The hotel is next to a cow pasture and the odor from the pasture is at times quite strong.
review.positiveRemarks: Very helpful staff, nice pool area and excellent breakfast buffet.
review.negativeRemarks: I realize it is impossible to move the hotel, however it is very hard to find.
review.locationRemarks: The location is about 10 miles out of the center of Novato. There is nothing nearby. About 30 minutes north of the Golden Gate Bridge.

review.title: Very nice hotel but it is in a terrible location.
review.reviewText:
Very nice room, staff, pool area and breakfast buffet. It is next to a cow pasture and the odor is pretty bad.
It is five to ten miles outside the town of Novato which I didn't realize when booking the hotel.
We had trouble finding it. No one in town knew where it was !
review.positiveRemarks: Swimming pool area, breakfast buffet, and helpful staff.
review.negativeRemarks: Move to the center of town. Realize this won't happen
review.locationRemarks: Horrible location. Next to a cow pasture. 30 minutes north of San Francisco. We will not stay there again.

review.title: Pleasant Enough
review.reviewText:
I would have rated it higher if there was no Power problem in our first night of stay that we had to leave and find another hotel to stay which cost us a lot because we did not have any reservation. The hotel did not have any power in the entire building for six hours!!!!

We came back the following day to finish our stay because of the reasonable price of our stay - it was pleasant after that. The location is very quite since it was away from the freeway and traffic noise.
review.positiveRemarks: Staff are friendly, and accommodations are acceptable in comparison to the price they charge. The hotel is quite too which is good.
review.negativeRemarks: I wish they can put back the restaurant they just closed. We were told it will reopen.
review.locationRemarks: It is near enough Sausalito, Larkspur and Petaluma that you can do good shopping or take the Ferry and enjoy the ride to San Francisco Embarcadero.

review.title: A good, economical place to stay.
review.reviewText: The room was large and clean with a nice view of the courtyard and hills behind the hotel. I was on the side near the freeway which I could hear, but was not loud enough to bother me. If you are sensitive to noise, ask for a room away from the road.
review.locationRemarks: The location was a bit hard to find the first time, but is conveniently located near Novato and San Rafael.

review.title: A Good Family Place and Very Pleasant Staff.
review.reviewText: It was a great place to stay for the bucks. Good to explore the Marin County trails.

review.title: people make a difference
review.reviewText: after expedia sqrewed up our non smoking 2 bed request, a very over worked staff person asked if we could wait 45 min for a clean room with an extra bed. we were accomidated in 20 minutes. they went the extra effort on a busy day, thanks

review.title: Thank God for the Ice Bucket!
review.reviewText: This motel clearly has seen better days. Peeling wallpaper. The bathroom sink laminate apparently came loose and someone tried gluing it back in place with white caulk. That failed and then two now-rusty nails were face-nailed to hold it in place. Lamps tilted at crazy angles. The big, old-style cathode ray tube TV apparently had fallen off the credenza at one point (1989 earthquake, perhaps?) and suffered a big crack in the case. Lumpy comforter under the spread. The queen bed was barely tolerable. But the crowning blow came the next morning when we went to take showers. The shower head could not be made to deliver water. The diverter valve, which usually is in the tub spout, is an old-style sliding rod in the water pipe just before the showerhead itself. No amount of fiddling could produce a shower spray. So for the first time since the last century, we took sort-of tub baths, helped along by, wait for it, clean water rinses using the ice bucket. Traffic noise from adjacent US 101 was intrusive during sleep time.
review.positiveRemarks: Nothing. Even with a 15 percent discount for no-shower it cost us $66.17. Highway robbery.
review.negativeRemarks: Just about everything, including replacing one of the breakfast room toaster knobs.
review.locationRemarks: Anything else -- food, gas, etc. -- is a several-mile 10-minute drive back down the service road to civilization. If you like roughing it, go for it.

review.title: Nice hotel close to San Francisco
review.reviewText: I had read other reviews and was worried about our reservation here, but it turned out to be a nice hotel. The back sliding door does seem creepy if you are traveling alone, but we were fine. Friendly staff, clean and updated rooms, decent breakfast, great location. I would recommend.

review.title: Novato hwy 101
review.reviewText: Courteous, friendly staff. Older motel but comfortable.....has what you need.
review.negativeRemarks: Asked for Spa Towels and was told we had to use the room towels. We had 3 people and were only given 3 towels.
review.locationRemarks: Convenient location. Easy to buy food, gas, shopping etc. Located right next to hwy 101. Still is quiet.d

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Face it - you're staying here for the price - take it for what it is - a reasonably priced, roadside place to stay with good, mostly clean rooms (bathrooms are clean every time I stay here. And the rooms are quiet the further you are from the freeway, so you can get a good night's sleep.
review.negativeRemarks: Electrical plugs - not many in room or conveniently located - and most are not grounded 3-way plugs (old two-prong)
review.locationRemarks: Need to drive into downtown Novato for food and services.Enzo

review.title: Dog Friendly
review.reviewText: Nice dog friendly motel in Novato close to where we wanted to be. The motel is old but very comfortable and clean. Pool and spa looked nice although the pool is seasonal. Motel manager was friendly and helpful.
review.positiveRemarks: Manager, cleanliness, comfort of bed and bedding.

review.title: Had to move to another hotel in the middle night.
review.reviewText: I made a reservation through the website of Expedia for a nonsmoking room in San Francisco-Days Inn, Novato. When we arrived the hotel at 10:30 pm, the hotel attendant in the front desk told us that there was no nonsmoking room available because Expedia has no guarantee for you to have a nonsmoking room even they promised you could. She led us to a heavily smoking and very sticky room. We were infected by the sticky smell just in a minute in the room. She said that you are welcome to cancel your reservation and go to anther hotel if you do not like the room. We felt lost in that moment by looking the clock close to the middle night in a dark day since we were not sure where to go. Finally, we called our friend to help and cancelled hotel reservation even we do not know if we can get a full refund from Expedia.
review.negativeRemarks: Too many things are wrong in this place.
review.locationRemarks: Do not know.

review.title: Nice alternative outside San Francisco
review.reviewText: This hotel was a nice place to stay for the price when hotels in San Francisco are at least $150.00 per night. The room is comfortable and pretty quiet. It has a coffee maker, microwave and a refrigerator which will come in handy if you have leftovers from the Mandarin restaurant next door. There's a free breakfast which consists of hard boiled eggs, bagels, toast, milk, apple juice, coffee, tea, apples and oranges, oatmeal, cereal, frozen waffles and condiments.
review.positiveRemarks: I liked how comfortable and quiet this hotel was. The neighbors were louder than the freeway noise.
review.negativeRemarks: The grout in the bathroom needs to be cleaned but nothing else stands out.
review.locationRemarks: There's a plaza with shopping and restaurants at the next exit south of Atherton but nothing else within comfortable walking distance.

review.title: Good place to stay
review.reviewText: Needed a place to stay close to Petaluma. This was a nice, comfortable hotel ... reasonable rate. Staff was friendly and professional.
review.negativeRemarks: No

review.title: Hwy noise like sleeping under a highway bridge!
review.reviewText: Hello, I stayed at this hotel because of the cost, cheapest place I could find near to the Marin Center where i was attending a conference which was a 10 mile drive south. The hotel advertises as a Spa Hotel, in reality its a roadside hotel, clean but getting old. Extension cords run behind appliances that don't have a ground plug. Mainly no complaints except for the highway noise. Weekends are better but weekdays with commuting traffic it was so loud, a constant droning. Upon checkout however, hotel receptionist embarrassed me about the bill. When i made the reservation with Expedia it required me to pay upfront by request of hotel with credit card which i did and i got a confirmation email saying it was paid. When i checked out the man would not accept the prepaid, he said They as in Expedia do this all the time and they haven't received payment from me, of which he didn't check anything to come to that conclusion. So as i stood there, he said will you step aside as i check these people out, this is getting ridiculous. I stood there as other conference attendees watched, and I then proceeded to call Expedia to clear it up. I won't stay here again.

review.negativeRemarks: Tear it down and rebuild

review.title: Great Night
review.reviewText: Nice comfy room. Looking out the window at the beautiful courtyard was nice. Super pool area.

review.negativeRemarks: It is too old and needs a make over.

review.title: Decent hotel for a great price!
review.reviewText: Hotel staff were VERY nice and helpful. Great economic alternative when visiting the Sonoma area. Not a high end hotel by any means but definietly worth the savings! They are also dog friendly and have a great area on site for dogs to run around. Mandarin restaurant on site too which was awesome!

review.title: Nice Hotel
review.reviewText:
We stayed here for one night the room is very spacious, neat and there is a nice view outside the room.

I refer my friends

review.title: Nice Experience - Pet Friendly
review.reviewText: It's hard to find a decent place to stay where our lab puppy is welcome. We were happy to pay an extra $10 to accommodate him. The room smelled and looked clean. The bathroom light was on a very short timer, and we were left in the dark while in the bathroom...but really that's no big deal. The water could have been hotter (for me), but still...can't really complain. We would stay here again if we needed a place in that area.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotter water.
review.locationRemarks: N/A

review.title: Very nice hotel.
review.reviewText:
Great staff! Very nice room. Comfortable mattress. Clean. Nice grassy patio near pool. Quiet!!!
Would have been nice to have fridge and micro, since it was a suite. Most motels have them in every room now.

review.title: Days Inn is not the place to go in
review.reviewText: The hotel is right on the freeway and some hotels take steps to make sure the noise does not affect people in their rooms. This hotel is older and I could hear the traffice noise.
review.negativeRemarks: New carpet, dual pane windows, a comfortable bed, clean tables in the breakfast areas, an elevator and a better road.
review.locationRemarks: There is a lot to see and do in Marin county.

review.title: reasonable lodging near coast
review.reviewText: very reasonable lodging, great location, good breakfast, attached Chinese restaurant with excellent food.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel and rooms could use a bit of updating.
review.locationRemarks: close to Pt Reyes, Petaluma, Santa Rosa

review.title: The room and facilities felt very odd...
review.reviewText: The hotel staff was very nice. A couple interesting things to sign but nothing major. Clearly they've had a problem with people leaving items behind because now you sign saying they are not responsible for leaving items in your room. The hotel over all needs a LOT of updating. It's clean (as clean as it it can get). But the furniture and fixtures need replaced... It's time for them to go to their final resting place. Each set of exterior room doors are blocked by a "decorative" wall, which makes it very difficult to find your room number.
review.negativeRemarks: New Beds, new dressers, new TVs, gut and rebuild the bathroom, new carpet, etc. etc...
review.locationRemarks: Over odd location... the exit is about a mile past the hotel (when heading south on 101). and it appears the hotel is at the end of this dead end rd.

review.title: Good for the price.
review.reviewText: Great place for construction workers. The Chinese restraint was good.

review.title: My "non-smoking" room reeked like cigarettes
review.reviewText: My "non-smoking" room reeked like cigarettes and there were what appeared to be blood stains on the carpet.

review.title: Not bad at all
review.reviewText: It's an older motel but for the money it was just fine. Very clean, very comfortable bed, big screen tv. I've seen way worse. The staff was very helpful.
review.negativeRemarks: Update
review.locationRemarks: We stayed in Novato to save money for a workshop in Sonoma.

review.title: Nice but load in the morning due traffic
review.reviewText: Nice but right on the freeway so a little traffic noise early morning
review.negativeRemarks: Older rooms need updating

review.title: mildew in bath room
review.reviewText: could not believe that they would allow mildew in bath room;with pached up plumbing.hadto ask twice for room service.
review.negativeRemarks: fix the problems.
review.locationRemarks: isolate location from everything.

review.title: Needed an inexpensive place to stay for a wedding
review.reviewText: The Front desk manager was very nice and helpful. He printed us directions us to a restaurant and the wedding. The outside of the hotel is very dated, but the rooms were better than I was expecting. My only complaint was that the room air conditioner didn't seem to cool off the room...

review.title: Good only for one night
review.reviewText: The room smells and the bath tube has hair still from the previous guest, I asked for a quiet room and the one we got had some vibration on the floor coming from the valves for jets of the hot tub. Not coming back.
review.positiveRemarks: Hot tub has glass walls to protect against the wind
review.negativeRemarks: cleanliness
review.locationRemarks: Close to Tiburon Feryr terminal

review.title: A good bargain place to stay -
review.reviewText: On a limited budget, I was able to visit the San Francisco Bay Area in my search for employment thanks to this lodging location.
review.positiveRemarks: It is a standard motel and room. It is comfortable and quite clean and well maintained.
review.negativeRemarks: I would have appreciated a small refrigerator.
review.locationRemarks: It's the SF Bay Area - there's anything you want to do close by. I was traveling on a job search and doing some networking.

review.title: Nice inexpensive hotel close to Sonoma raceway
review.reviewText: Very helpful and friendly staff. We arrived on Thursday and found no refrigerator in the room, went to the front desk to ask about it. The girl was very polite and friendly and tried to find us one. About twenty minutes later we had a knock on the slider door and there was a fridge being delivered Thank You to all the friendly staff We enjoyed our stay.
review.positiveRemarks: Nice staff, clean rooms. Nice view of pool and grass area.
review.locationRemarks: Location was good. Shopping center and restaurant close by the frwy. Close to the raceway.

review.title: Easy to find
review.reviewText: Easy access off 101. Good place to stop before san Fransisco
review.positiveRemarks: The pool and hot tub were nice

review.title: Convenient Location, that's about it.
review.reviewText: It was a very convenient location for my fiance and I. We were trying to do a mini get away and decided to drive halfway up to our destination so we wouldn't have to wake up so early the next day. The girl at the front desk was nice. The ice machine was broken so they had a cooler full of ice at the front desk. She offered to fill our small cooler. The room looked decent but it smelled like smoke (it was non-smoking room) and when I pull the covers back there was a lot of random hairs... So we slept on top of the blankets and used a small throw we brought to cover us. The bathroom wasn't bad but there was obviously some mold problem.. the caulking was pretty messed up and you could see mold coming from under it. I also turned on the heater but decided not to keep it running because it smelled like burnt hair. The continental breakfast wasn't bad but I've seen better. They had frozen waffles, bagels, english muffins boiled eggs, regular cheerios and frosted flakes. Clean bedding is a must! For that reason I would not recommend.
review.positiveRemarks: It is right off of the highway. Had Coin Washer and Dryer (although we did not use it).
review.negativeRemarks: Bedding Cleanliness. Generally could use a remodel.
review.locationRemarks: About 40 Minutes away from Santa Rosa. Right off of the highway.

review.title: OK to stay
review.reviewText:
Though the bed was comfortable, the room ,especially the tv was very dated. The remote did not work andthe replacement would only change channels in the reverse dirction. The lock on the sliding door worked only if you held your toungue just right, one person lifted the door and the second person latched the door. the hotels solution was to drill a hole in the top of the door and frame, but not replacing the rollers on the bottom of the door (very hard to roll).
The entire facility looked like the last time it had been painted was when it had been built. The condition of the pool was deplorable. to the point that I did not go swimming, though we had chosen the hotel because it had a pool.
Would NOT stay second a time at this location (Novato, CA), which is diappointing because of our previous good to great experience with Day's Inn.
review.negativeRemarks: Most everything but the bed
review.locationRemarks: Tshe location is excelleant for it's proximaty to San Francisco, Napa Valley and the many other things close by

review.title: Ok stay
review.reviewText: Was good for one night. Only the wifi wasnt working good at all

review.title: Wonderful bed and view close to everything.
review.reviewText: Traveling up the coast and this was the most comfortable and economical from LA to San Fran area! Only downside was continental breakfast was skimpy.
review.positiveRemarks: Rhe bed ans lots of pillows!
review.negativeRemarks: Breakfast variety
review.locationRemarks: Nascar, Golden Gate Bridge, ocean and more!

review.title: Good hotel for the "budget traveler"
review.reviewText:
With three small children, I appreciated being able to slide open the door onto the enclosed, nicely landscaped, grassy courtyard to let them run around. The pool is fully fenced, so I wasn't worried about them going into that area.

We can also attest that we saw the top comforters getting washed and changed in other rooms.

The fridge was powerful but noisy. The microwave was up to standards.

The bed was comfortable, as beds in higher-star-bracket hotels.

The hotel is right next to the freeway, as heard clearly from the lobby, but I didn't hear a thing for the room,

It was quiet for most of our stay, though the last night there were two drunk women loudly complaining about their boyfriends' fishing habits outside near our door. The noise didn't penetrate enough to awaken the kids.

review.title: Smoking hotel
review.reviewText: Room smelt like ash tray! The room was dirty if you want to smell like cigarets stay here!

review.title: Will stay there again.
review.reviewText: It is fine to stay, especially at the reasonable price. It is closer to Highway 101, but our room (which is father away from the road) is quiet.

review.title: Cheap
review.reviewText: You get what you pay for. Not really pretty but it was decent.

review.title: Blissful hotel stay!
review.reviewText: The manager here was SO helpful!! Three of us stayed here and were taken care of very well. The staff showed obvious concern for our comfort. The location was safe and convenient with a beautiful hillside and wild turkeys to greet us in the morning. The hot tub and breakfast were fabulous perks. If ever we visit Novato or San Francisco again, we will absolutely be staying here! Also, there is a mandarin restaurant down stairs, and staff 23/7.
review.positiveRemarks: The hot tub and breakfast were our favorites.
review.negativeRemarks: You won't hear any complaints from me!
review.locationRemarks: It is close to the freeway and set away from anything else so we felt safe.

review.title: Great value for $
review.reviewText: A little off the beaten path, but value for your $! Nice little basic breakfast options, clean room & dining area. Staff was very pleasant. I really didn't use any amenities besides breakfast, so can rate those. Only minor gripe was that the heat/air controls were not temperature identified, so you choose either heat or air, level 1,2 or 3, etc .... Which is hard to judge how hot or cold it will be after it starts cranking. Ended up boiling after 2 hours of sleep, then freezing an hour befor I woke up ... Not a HUGE issue, I figured it out by 2nd night.
review.negativeRemarks: Heating / air intructions

review.title: if you get a clean room, maybe......
review.reviewText: the first room smelled and had flies - lots of flies. the door latch swung closed when i left room and had to wait 20 minutes or so before the maintenance man opened it with his trick tool. they moved me to another room, and ... flies! this room was in better shape (except for the flies!), but still didn't feel so clean. add to that the odd dead end street next to the noisy freeway.....
review.negativeRemarks: flies. lots of flies.
review.locationRemarks: off the beaten path, not in a good way.

review.title: value and location near San Francisco
review.reviewText: Low price for room, but overall impression is a chain that is neglected. If there is no further investment in some upgrades and cleaning staff, I would not recommend it. Staff was very helpful and nice though and they had a decent breakfast and breakfast room Too dark to see pool area.
review.negativeRemarks: just not as clean as I am comfortable with, general impression of in process of getting old and run down.
review.locationRemarks: slightly off freewaay exit on "feeder" road, but actually very good location once you found it. Would try again just for this.

review.title: Great Hotel!
review.reviewText: This hotel was very nice and comforting an added plus when you walk in your room the lights turn on for you. I even left my glasses at the desk and they called me right away to come get them, so nice. Its also very peaceful and quiet I didn't hear anyone outside no kids nothing. I'm so going back to this hotel for my next trip.
review.locationRemarks: Its peaceful and convenient.

review.title: Noisy
review.reviewText:
Just very noisy: people outside fighting, engines running for some reason all night and the freeway is really loud. I had a bad night of sleep, woke up 4-5 times.
The room itself is clean.

review.title: Quiet getaway
review.reviewText: My boyfriend is going to school up north and I try and visit once a month. The cost and quality of the hotel was just what we were looking for. Very quiet, nice staff, free breakfast and a hot tub. Very pleased with our stay. The hotel is older but it was still great service

review.title: Great Value
review.reviewText: The staff was nice, the room was clean and the value was excellent.

review.title: Nice hotel for a one night stay
review.reviewText: This hotel was ok for a quick trip. It's a bit isolated and, from the outside, looks a bit run down, but the rooms are clean with decent amenities. The hotel staff we encountered were extremely nice and helpful. The included breakfast was a great perk.

review.title: Great location
review.reviewText: It took forever to get checked in. It seemed like something was up with our reservation because the girl and guy were whispering something. We got two rooms one was being paid for with cash the other was with a credit card it was a different price she charged the wrong room on the credit card. Not very well trained. The room was great.
review.positiveRemarks: Location to the wedding we were attending.
review.negativeRemarks: the time it took to get checked in and no food at the breakfast at 9:00 am

review.title: Nice hotel for the price
review.reviewText: Nice place over all. Bathroom a little small but ok. A little isolated off the main path. Staff friendly. Pool area real nice and peaceful. Rooms in front you can hear freeway. resturants and shopping down the road, not to far. Good chineese resturant in hotel.
review.positiveRemarks: Clean room and nice view of the pool area
review.negativeRemarks: Small sink area in bathroom
review.locationRemarks: A little off the main path

review.title: Not Bad for the Money
review.reviewText: This hotel is older, but they do keep it up to a reasonable standard for the price. It's also easy to get to from the highway.

review.title: Out of the way good hotel
review.reviewText: Everything was fine and the breakfast was adequate. A little further out than we had hoped, but all was OK.

review.title: Good value for $
review.reviewText: Good central location for San Francisco and Marin County, Point Reyes Seashore, etc. Was worried about highway noise because of proximity to road, but not so bad. For the price the place has a pool, exercise room, nice courtyard and decent free breakfast. Also has a on site chinese restaurant (did not try). Need to watch time if driving on highway 101 to avoid rush hours, since traffic can be terrible, but this would apply to the entire area.
review.negativeRemarks: Some highway noise and not within walking distance of any activities (shopping, food etc.)
review.locationRemarks: Good base location for North Bay.

review.title: Novato Days Inn
review.reviewText: Bed was a little too soft, air conditioner was intermittent.
review.positiveRemarks: Mandarin Restaraunt, and washer and dryer.
review.negativeRemarks: Air Conditioner
review.locationRemarks: Easy to find lots of parking.

review.title: Sonoma Race
review.reviewText: Overall hotel is in a great location for access to Sonoma Raceway...not too far from track.

review.title: Little hotel by the freeway.
review.reviewText: A little noisy being so close to the freeway. The Chinese restaurant looked interesting. Free breakfast provided by the hotel.
review.negativeRemarks: Freeway noise
review.locationRemarks: A little off the beaten track, but not too far away.

review.title: Good no frills motel
review.reviewText: This is a no frills motel right off the 101 freeway in Novato. Nothing fancy but everything was adequate. The breakfast, which included make them yourself waffles, was good.

review.title: served its purpose
review.reviewText: Not spectacular but it served its purpose and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

review.title: Comfortable Stay in Novato
review.reviewText: Days Inn - Novato is a great bargain. It's comfortable, clean, and close to the freway. The continental breakfast is always full of treats and the attendant is constantly making sure the guests are pleased. There is also a Chinese restaurant on the premise... which we did not visit. No iron in room, but the staff will quickly get you one. Swimming pool is also available and was quite welcome during the warm afternoon in Marin County. San Francisco is about 10 minutes away and Napa around a 20 minute drive.
review.negativeRemarks: Hotel is hidden and away from downtown Novato.
review.locationRemarks: Close to freeway... but hidden.

review.title: great time
review.reviewText: i thought the stay was great people were friendly and the hotel was clean as was the pool and hot tub.
review.positiveRemarks: easy to get too off the freeway
review.negativeRemarks: n/a
review.locationRemarks: was awesome right by a small town with food and bars and quiet

review.title: Nice time
review.reviewText: The manager at the front desk was so very friendly. And the breakfast was great. Loved the waffles. Little far from area places to eat but it was a great place to stay.
review.negativeRemarks: Lil on the older side
review.locationRemarks: near the freeway

review.title: Good value
review.reviewText: Best value for the area. Close to Highway, but not an issue. Grounds are nice with view of hills. Restaurant was very good with pleasant, attentive staff. Would stay here again.

review.title: Disappointing Room
review.reviewText: Booked items are not available in room. If you stay more than night , room is not cleaning everyday.
review.negativeRemarks: Everything

review.title: Not a 4
review.reviewText: Air conditioning was very loud. Iron was not located in our room. I contacted the front desk and they said come to the front desk and pick one up. Little inconvient since i wanted to iron my clothes before I have leave my room.
review.negativeRemarks: Bed and pillows very uncomfortable. Bed did not support us very well.
review.locationRemarks: Quiet against nice foothills

review.title: MY STAY
review.reviewText: VERY NICE ROOMS STAFF WAS NICE THEY ALSO SERVE A NICE BREAKFAST.
review.positiveRemarks: THE POOL WAS NICE AS I WAS THERE WHEN WEATHER WAS HOT

review.title: Plug-in Friendly
review.reviewText: The desk clerk allowed me to plug-in my electric motorcycle to charge up a couple of hours here and there, as I ran around the Novato area.
review.negativeRemarks: The bed was overdue to be replaced - the mattress was lumpy and sagged in the middle.
review.locationRemarks: Conveniently located near Sear's Point, San Rafeal - and just a hop and a skip from Saucelito.

review.title: An affordable place worth staying in Marin!
review.reviewText:
Best cheap (for Marin) place to stay in Marin, once you get over the location (NOT central, although a good locale for hikers).

No worries about cleanliness or maintenance often associated with budget accommodations. Continental breakfast included eggs, bagels and waffles! Sorry I didn't bring my suit for the pool or jacuzzi.
review.positiveRemarks: Well maintained and the continental breakfast is a REAL breakfast!
review.negativeRemarks: Alas, the location.
review.locationRemarks: Right near the highway; but the windows face the back, where the views of the beautiful hills are.

review.title: Days inn novato
review.reviewText:
Good clean hotel
Cheap for new years eve
20 miles fom san francisco
Help full staff

review.title: Not Impressed at all
review.reviewText:
The place was dirty. Parking lot was littered with small piles of garbage. The outside corridors were littered with debris too. Mattress was worn to the point that I rolled into the middle of the bed.

But, the big thing was that when I checked in I was told of the breakfast in the morning. I asked what was served and they told me "full" breakfasts, including eggs. Since I'm on a high protein diet I thought was great and I made sure I participated. But when I arrived for breakfast there were no eggs. Not one. Just carbohydrates, which I must limit.

I won't go back to this hotel.

review.title: Good Value
review.reviewText:
Probably the best deal in Marin. Surprisingly quiet establishment (for its proximity to the freeway), with hills boasting oaks, deer, and a variety of birds. An attractive pool and hot tub, as well as a water feature to provide soothing white noise. Friendly, competent staff. I did have to request my refrigerator and microwave multiple times before it appeared. Clean, simple room with nice sheets and pillow cases.

The website did provide very old information. I was glad I called ahead of time to confirm some details.

review.title: Very nice accommodations!
review.reviewText: The office staff were extremely helpful in making every effort to upgrade our room when what we needed at the time wasn't available!

review.title: Safe, clean, friendly, quiet, cheap
review.reviewText: This was my first stay and it was just what I wanted (safe, clean, quiet, friendly) cheaply done. It is an older, 2-story layout surrounding a large pool and spa with a nice grassy area that is child-safe. The first floor rooms open out onto the grassy area, which is perfect for relaxing outside without going into the gated pool area (I read while my young daughter played with some other children). Each time we returned to the room, I propped open the front & sliding back doors to allow the breeze to flow through and that removed the common smell found in older hotels after just a couple minutes. There was a small refrigerator/freezer, microwave, coffee maker, hair dryer, t.v. and free in-room wi-fi connection, everything I needed to make our 3-night stay very comfortable. There are plenty of shopping centers, eateries and coffee shops close by to make a home-away-from-home stay convenient and relatively inexpensive. We will return to this location when we want to be north of San Francisco, but with easy access to the city as needed. Note: I'd suggest asking for a room away from the Housekeeping storage areas if you are a late sleeper, one morning they were very noisy, the other two, I didn't even hear them.

review.title: Good, deal, very pleasant environment.
review.reviewText: This is the second time I have stayed here. It is a good value, and the management maintains a nice feel to the place. It is not fancy, but the pool and grounds are very nice, and it is very convenient to Petaluma. I would return.

review.title: Good, Basic Hotel
review.reviewText: This hotel isn't spectacular, but it doesn't charge spectacular prices, either. The room was clean, quiet, and a nice little continental breakfast was available.
